sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"礼物，赠品"之意。
means: gift ： 含义广，既可指真诚相送的礼物、赠品或生日、节日礼物，又可指捐赠的物品或捐款等。
present ： 普通用词，指给亲朋好友的礼物，赠者与被赠者之间存在某种个人关系，所赠礼物一般不是很昂贵的。
souvenir ： 指对人、物、地点或事件有纪念意义的礼物或纪念品。
tip ： 指为酬谢他人服务而给的小费。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"倾斜"之意。
means: tip ： 指向一边倾斜或向上翻转、失去平衡或完全翻转过来。
slope ： 指向上或向下渐渐倾斜的表面，多用于山、屋顶等缓缓倾斜。
tilt ： 指有意识地或长时间地使物体处于倾斜状态。

word_mean: 装夹在刀体上的片状物体，并由它形成刀具的切削部分。

sentence.Network_en: Here's an inside tip: The faster you rise, the harder you fall.
sentence.Network_cn: 给你一个小忠告：爬得越快，摔得越疼。

sentence.Network_en: She poked and shifted things with the tip of her walking stick.
sentence.Network_cn: 她用手杖尖翻拨挪动东西。

sentence.Network_en: It is usual to tip waiters, porters, guides and drivers.
sentence.Network_cn: 给服务员、行李搬运工、导游和司机小费是惯例。

phrase.cizu_name: on the tip of one's tongue

jx.jx_en_mean: used to indicate that one is almost but not quite able to bring a particular word or name to mind
jx.jx_cn_mean: 就在某人的嘴边，某人差一点就能想起的

lj.lj_ly: his name's on the tip of my tongue!.
lj.lj_ls: 他的名字就在我嘴边（可就是想不起）!。

lj.lj_ly: his name's on the tip of my tongue!.
lj.lj_ls: 他的名字就在我嘴边（可就是想不起）!。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (美，非正式)无意中流露自己的意图

jx.jx_en_mean: raise or touch one's hat or cap as a way of greeting or acknowledging someone
jx.jx_cn_mean: 以手触帽檐（或脱帽）致敬

phrase.cizu_name: tip (或 turn) the scales (或 balance)

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a circumstance or event) be the deciding factor; make the critical difference
jx.jx_cn_mean: （状况，事件）起决定性作用；扭转局面

lj.lj_ly: her proven current form &B{tips the scales in her favour}.
lj.lj_ls: 她目前表现的确不错，使局面变得对她很有利。

jx.jx_en_mean: have a weight of (a specified amount)

lj.lj_ly: this phone tips the scales at only 150 g.
lj.lj_ls: 这个电话机重量只有150克。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)give someone information about something, typically in discreet or confidential way
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)向某人透露消息，暗中通知某人

lj.lj_ly: they were arrested after police were tipped off by local residents.
lj.lj_ls: 当地居民暗中通知警察后他们被逮捕了。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)向某人送暗号（或使眼色）

jx.jx_en_mean: To attach (an insert) in a book by gluing along the binding edge
jx.jx_cn_mean: 加入：用粘贴的方式在书中加（一个插页）

jx.jx_en_mean: To register weight (at a certain amount).
jx.jx_cn_mean: 称量：称得重量（为某个数目）

jx.jx_en_mean: To offset the balance of a situation.
To reveal one's resources or intentions.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 显露：揭示自己的财产或目的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old Norse typpi (noun), typpa (verb), typptr 'tipped'; related to top
late Middle English: perhaps of Scandinavian origin, influenced later by tip in the sense 'touch with a tip or point'. Current senses of the noun date from the mid 19th cent
early 17th cent. (in the sense 'give, hand, pass'): probably from tip

encyclopedia.content: TIP-B多维脑神经调控康复体系 失眠抑郁症等其他精神疾病是由大脑神经元异常，导致短暂中枢神经及系统植物紊乱功能失常的慢性脑部疾病。 最新研究表明：神经元异常放电的直接原因是神经元膜不稳定，根本原因是兴奋性与抑制性神经递质的失衡。兴奋性神经递质过多，或抑制性神经递质过少，都会导致神经元膜不稳定，从而产生神经元受损引发各种精神疾病。 TIP-B多维脑神经调控康复体系 基于这个基础上，采用美国第二代（脑神经递质检

entry.def: The tip of something long and narrow is the end of it.

example.ex: The sleeves covered his hands to the tips of his fingers...
example.tran: 袖子遮住了他的手，一直盖到指尖。

example.ex: She poked and shifted things with the tip of her walking stick...
example.tran: 她用手杖尖翻拨挪动东西。

entry.def: If you tip an object or part of your body or if it tips, it moves into a sloping position with one end or side higher than the other.

example.ex: He leaned away from her, and she had to tip her head back to see him...
example.tran: 他倾着身子避开她，她不得不把头向后歪着看他。

example.ex: A young boy is standing on a stool, reaching for a cookie jar, and the stool is about to tip...
example.tran: 一个小男孩正站在凳子上，伸手够一个曲奇罐子，凳子眼看就要歪了。

entry.def: If you tip something somewhere, you pour it there.

example.ex: Tip the vegetables into a bowl...
example.tran: 把蔬菜倒进碗里。

example.ex: She took out the plate, stared blankly at the dried-up food on it, and tipped it into the bin…
example.tran: 她拿出盘子，茫然地望着上面已经干掉的食物，然后把它倒进了垃圾桶。

entry.def: To tip rubbish means to get rid of it by leaving it somewhere.

example.ex: ...the costs of tipping rubbish in landfills...
example.tran: 在废弃物填埋场倾倒垃圾的成本

example.ex: How do you stop people tipping?...
example.tran: 你怎样阻止人们乱倒垃圾呢？

entry.def: A tip is a place where rubbish is left.

example.ex: Officers had found a large bread knife on the rubbish tip…
example.tran: 警察在垃圾场发现了一把很大的面包刀。

example.ex: I took a load of rubbish and grass cuttings to the tip.
example.tran: 我把一堆垃圾与修剪下的碎草运到了垃圾场。

entry.def: If you describe a place as a tip, you mean it is very untidy.

example.ex: The flat is an absolute tip.
example.tran: 这套公寓简直就是个垃圾场。

entry.def: If you tip someone such as a waiter in a restaurant, you give them some money in order to thank them for their services.

example.ex: Do you really think it's customary to tip the waiters?...
example.tran: 你真的认为给侍者小费是约定俗成的吗？

example.ex: She tipped the barmen 10 dollars and bought drinks all round.
example.tran: 她给了吧台服务员 10 美元小费，还请在场的所有人喝了酒。

entry.def: If you give a tip to someone such as a waiter in a restaurant, you give them some money to thank them for their services.

example.ex: I gave the barber a tip...
example.tran: 我给了理发师小费。

example.ex: The Head Porter was keeping all the tips.
example.tran: 行李员领班扣留了所有人的小费。

entry.def: A tip is a useful piece of advice.

example.ex: It shows how to prepare a CV, and gives tips on applying for jobs.
example.tran: 它说明了如何准备简历，并就如何申请职位提了些建议。

example.ex: …tips for busy managers…
example.tran: 给繁忙的经理们的忠告

entry.tran: 认定…会(做某事或获得成功)
entry.def: If a person is tipped to do something or is tipped for success at something, experts or journalists believe that they will do that thing or achieve that success.

example.ex: He is tipped to be the country's next foreign minister...
example.tran: 他被认定会成为该国下一任外交部长。

example.ex: He was widely tipped for success.
example.tran: 大家都认定他会成功。

entry.tran: (对赛马、比赛结果的)预测，内幕消息
entry.def: Someone's tip for a race or competition is their advice on its likely result, especially to someone who wants to bet money on the result.

example.ex: I've a tip for the races…
example.tran: 我有一条关于赛马比赛的内部消息。

example.ex: United are still my tip for the Title.
example.tran: 我仍然认定联队会夺冠。

entry.tran: (事物的)端倪，表面一小部分，冰山一角
entry.def: If you say that a problem is the tip of the iceberg, you mean that it is one small part of a much larger problem.

example.ex: Unless we're all a lot more careful, the people who have died so far will be just the tip of the iceberg.
example.tran: 除非我们都加倍小心，否则死者的人数会比现在多得多。

entry.def: If something tips the scales or tips the balance, it gives someone a slight advantage.

example.ex: Today's slightly shorter race could well help to tip the scales in his favour...
example.tran: 今天距离稍短的赛跑可能会对他占据优势大有助益。

example.ex: If the trial were evenly poised the newspapers might tip the balance against them.
example.tran: 如果选拔赛双方打平，报界可能会使形势朝着不利于他们的方向倾斜。

entry.def: If a comment or question is on the tip of your tongue, you really want to say it or ask it, but you decide not to say it.

example.ex: It was on the tip of Mahoney's tongue to say the boss was out...
example.tran: 马奥尼想说老板出去了，话到嘴边却没说出口。

example.ex: A sarcastic remark was on the tip of her tongue.
example.tran: 挖苦的话到了她嘴边却没说出来。

means.word_mean: 1. the extreme end of something; especially something pointed
2. a relatively small amount of money given for services rendered (as by a waiter)
3. an indication of potential opportunity;

sentences.sentence: "he got a tip on the stock market"

means.word_mean: 4. a V shape;

sentences.sentence: "the cannibal's teeth were filed to sharp points"

means.word_mean: 5. the top point of a mountain or hill;

sentences.sentence: "the view from the peak was magnificent"
"they clambered to the summit of Monadnock"

means.word_mean: 1. cause to tilt;
2. mark with a tip;

sentences.sentence: "tip the arrow with the small stone"

means.word_mean: 3. give a tip or gratuity to in return for a service, beyond the agreed-on compensation;
4. cause to topple or tumble by pushing
5. to incline or bend from a vertical position;
6. walk on one's toes
7. strike lightly;
8. give insider information or advise to;

sentences.sentence: "He tipped off the police about the terrorist plot"

means.word_mean: 9. remove the tip from;

auth_sentence.content: Tip the pastry out onto a floured work surface.
auth_sentence.res_content: Tip the pastry out onto a floured work surface.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Tip the pastry out onto a floured work surface.

auth_sentence.content: Tip the vegetables into the pan with the sausages.
auth_sentence.res_content: Tip the vegetables into the pan with the sausages.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Tip the vegetables into the pan with the sausages.

auth_sentence.content: BUT this is only the tip of the iceburg.
auth_sentence.res_content: BUT this is only the tip of the iceburg.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: BUT this is only the tip of the iceburg.

abbreviation.mean_cn: 替普葛菲亚(意大利公司名称)
小费(原意为保证服务迅速)

means.word_mean: 末端，末梢；尖端

sentences.en: That stick has a metal tip.
sentences.cn: 那根手杖的顶端是铁的。

means.word_mean: (使)某物侧边提高, 倾斜, 翻倒

sentences.en: The boat tipped to one side.
He tipped his soup bowl towards himself.

means.word_mean: 将(所盛之物)倒出；倒掉，倒光；倾倒

sentences.en: She tipped the rubbish into a dustbin.

means.word_mean: 给小费

sentences.cn: 我给了搬运工人50便士小费。

means.word_mean: 轻打
就(某人或某事物)提出意见[建议]

sentences.en: He tipped me the wink not to buy at that price.
sentences.cn: 他眨眼暗示我按那个价格就不要买。

sentences.en: Ade has been widely tipped as the Prime Minister.
sentences.cn: 很多人认为艾德将继任首相。

sentences.en: Mr. Smith is being widely tipped to succeed the next President.
sentences.cn: 人们普遍猜测史密斯先生将任下一届总统。

means.word_mean: [美国英语]去掉(生长物的)尖端

sentences.en: The cow's horns have been tipped.

means.word_mean: 翻转，倒翻，倾覆(常与 over 连用)

sentences.en: The wind nearly tipped over the car.
sentences.cn: 大风几乎把汽车掀翻了。

jushi.english: The book gives some good central heating tips.
jushi.chinese: 这本书提供了集中供暖的一些好办法。

jushi.english: The tips of matches are covered with a chemical substance.
jushi.chinese: 火柴头上包着一层化学物质。

jushi.english: The tips of the fingers are particularly sensitive.
